Cow Face Pose:-
 1.Cow Face Pose, or gomukhasana, counters excessive convex curvature of the spine by opening up the heart center.

2. This particular pose is highly effective in releasing the shoulders and the upper back. 

3.Practicing cow face pose regularly helps to ease the excruciating upper back pain due to kryphosis. 

4.Sit comfortably on the floor, with your legs extended in front of you. 

5.Bend your right knee and press your right foot close to your left buttock. 

6.Bend your left knee and place you left leg over your right leg. Ensure that the left knee is placed directly over the right knee.

7. Lift your right arm up. Bend your right elbow and place your right hand (palms facing the back) directly between your shoulder blades. 

8.With an inhalation bend your left arm and slide your left hand up your spine (palms facing outwards). 

9.Now clasp your hands in a tight handshake. Roll your shoulders back and ensure that the right elbow is in line with your right ear. 

10.Hold this pose for 30 to 45 seconds.

Shoulder Rolls:-
 1.Stand or sit comfortably with a straight spine. Place your fingertips on top of your shoulders. 

2.Pull your elbows toward each other in the front of the body to stretch out the shoulder blades and upper back.

3. Pull them up to stretch the triceps. Fan them to
the side to stretch out the chest and front of the shoulders. 

4.Pull them towards each other in the back of the body for a deep shoulder and chest stretch. 

5.Hold each pose for several breaths.
